data.title: Cambodia jails another govt critic for defamation - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A court in Cambodia sentenced activist Ny Nak to two years in prison for incitement and defamation, the latest jailing of a dissident critical of the government.

data.title: Cyber Gang Kingpin Trained By Chinese Experts In Cambodia, Had Pakistani 'Handler' - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The alleged kingpin of an international cybercrime gang told police he was trained by Chinese experts in online fraud when he went to Cambodia.

data.title: Prak Sokhonn reappointed as Cambodia's foreign minister - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian lawmakers have reappointed experienced diplomat Prak Sokhonn as foreign minister.

data.title: Cambodia jails disabled man for ‘incitement’ through social media - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Authorities often unleash a crackdown on its citizens for peaceful expression of dissent.

data.title: MoU on territorial dispute with Cambodia clarified - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Koh Kut not part of talks.

data.title: Cambodia’s soft but sure break from big brother Vietnam - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia’s withdrawal from Vietnam-led triangle initiative signals shift toward more autonomy under new leader Hun Manet.

data.title: Thaksin says needless fears being whipped up about MOU44 - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Ex-PM explains it is just a document on topics to be discussed with Cambodia.

data.title: Thailand’s panel to resume talks with Cambodia will soon be ready: PM - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Paetongtarn says the new JTC will work under the MOU44 framework, adding that concerns over Ko Kut were unfounded as the island belongs to Thailand

data.title: After his arrest for Facebook posts, a Cambodian reporter says he will become a farmer instead - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: It’s tough being a reporter in Cambodia, whose government frowns on independent journalism that questions authority.

data.title: Hun Manet leads Cambodia out of Vietnam’s shadow - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia’s withdrawal from the 25-year-old Cambodia-Laos-Vietnam Development Triangle Area (CLV-DTA) framework signals a more assertive Cambodian foreign policy and portends a sharp decline in relations with Vietnam.

data.title: Nobel Prize-Winning Research Highlights Cambodia’s History of Extractive Institutions - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The work of Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James Robinson can help explain the government’s collusion in criminal activities like cyber-scams.

data.title: Nobel Prize-Winning Research Highlights Cambodia’s History of Extractive Institutions - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The work of Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James Robinson can help explain the government’s collusion in criminal activities like cyber-scams.

data.title: Charting Its Discourse: Cambodia’s Naval Vessel Acquisitions from China - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Rather than look a gift horse in the mouth, observers should consider Cambodian agency instead of assuming Cambodia is a pliant recipient of Chinese military aid.

data.title: The Release of Mech Dara: Speaking Truth to Power - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Strong international pressure plus U.S. concessions have forced the hand of a the country’s kleptocratic elite.

data.title: What’s Happened to Cambodia’s Thinking Class? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A recent article in the government-aligned Khmer Times reflects the etiolated state of public discourse in the country.

data.title: Cambodian journalist freed on bail after apologising for 'harmful' posts - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: An award-winning Cambodian journalist who was arrested on charges of inciting social unrest was freed on bail on Thursday, a day after the government released a video of the investigative reporter apologising.

data.title: Evictions and Evasions: State Involvement in Southeast Asia’s ‘Golden Era of Organized Crime’ - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Efforts to obscure or de-center state involvement in regional transnational crime are dangerous, because traditional approaches won’t work to counter crime co-perpetrated by states.

data.title: World Bank urged to condemn Cambodia's targeting of rights groups - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: 163 groups highlight worrying escalation in repression of critical voices in the Hun Manet-led nation.

data.title: Cambodia cracks down on illegal international surrogacy as demand remains high - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Once a hub for affordable surrogacy following restrictions in neighbouring countries, Cambodia is trying to curb the practice because of human trafficking concerns.

data.title: Anutin, Cambodian PM discuss cross-border trade, stronger ties - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The interior minister also expresses commitment to further collaboration as both countries approach the 75th anniversary of diplomatic relations.
